The Student Government Program (SGP) is the Philippines' program for pupil governments in elementary schools & student governments in secondary schools of the Department of Education
column2: under the Office of the Undersecretary for Regional Operations. It is the foremost co-curricular student organization authorized to implement pertinent programs
column4: and activities in Philippine schools as mandated by the Department of Education.

column1: The Philippines has a complex student union with different names such as student government
column2: the term used in all public secondary schools and some of the universities and/or colleges and student council for most of the colleges/universities.

column1: The Center for Students and Co-Curricular Affairs (CSCA) was established in 1996 in order to further facilitate co-curricular work of student councils in the country and mold them to be better leaders.

column2: the Supreme Student Governments were institutionalized starting with the establishment of the National Federation of Supreme Student Governments (NFSSG) with David Maulas of Bohol as its first National Federation President elected during the 1st National Leadership Training for Student Government Officers (NLTSGO). An institutionalized Constitution and By Laws of the Supreme Student Governments were enforced through a Department Order No. 43
column4: then revised in 2009 as per Department Order No. 79
column5: s. 2009. The second National Federation officers were elected September 2012 with Raja Barber of Oriental Mindoro as the 2nd National Federation President.

column1: In 2019 as per Department Order No. 85
column2: s. 2019. The final las set of National Federation officers were elected August 2019 with Jericho Ryan Chiong of Cagayan de Oro Misamis Oriental o as the last National Federation President.

column3: s. 2014 the Constitution and By-Laws of Supreme Pupil Governments in elementary schools and Supreme Student Governments in secondary schools around the country were unified. This marks the year where the Supreme Pupil Governments are institutionalized.

== ASSOCIATION OF PRIVATE SECONDARY SCHOOLS IN CAGAYAN DE ORO & MISAMIS ORIENTAL HISTORY ==
The Association of Private Secondary Schools in Cagayan de Oro and Misamis Oriental â€“ Federation of Student Governments
column2: is the union of Private Secondary Student Governments in Cagayan de Oro City and the province of Misamis Oriental.  APSSCOMOR-FSG traced its roots due to the call of four(4) different student governments: Merry Child School
column5: and Liceo de Cagayan University Junior High School
column6: who saw the need for the Private Secondary Student Governments to unite in a cause of collaboration to advance their ideals on the empowerment of Students.

column1: With the help and guidance of the Association of Private Secondary Schools in Cagayan de Oro and Misamis Oriental (APSSCOMOR)
column2: the organization of Private Secondary School Administrators
column3: the Student Governments from different Private Institutions converged in an event
column4: thus created the APSSCOMOR-FSG and elected its first officers under the leadership of Mr. Kyle Chester J. Cotacte
column5: who also led the four student governments that called for the creation of the federation. During its first year
column6: with the guidance of Mr. Jessie Andallasa
column7: the FSG's Moderator and Member of the APSSCOMOR Board
column8: the federation sought out to connect with its member student governments.  The prime achievement also of the first administration of the federation was earning a seat in the Oro Youth Development Council (OYDC) - the Highest Policy Recommending Body on youth affairs in Cagayan de Oro City. It enables the federation to participate in lobbying policies such as the Oro Youth Code of 2018 and the Students Rights and Welfare Ordinance (STRAW Ordinance) which the latter being proposed in the city council by the OYDC.
